Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2010 07:25PM wifemomx2 wrote: My BMX with TEs is scheduled for this Thurs. 6/17 and I am expecting 11 family members at the hospital for my surgery including my husband and parents. I really didn't want anyone other than those three but I didn't/ don't have the heart to let the others know that taking off from work to be there really isn't necessary. Since all of my family has shown overwhelming support I guess the least I can do is allow them to be there for me since it seems to mean so much to them. I 'm thinking that I probably won't be up to seeing them all after I come out from recovery though.

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2010 07:06PM wifemomx2 wrote: Hey Ladies, After a week and a day post surgery, I finally got my drains removed this morning. I was frightened because they had been in longer than I expected and I've heard some women say that the drains began to fuse to the skin which makes them a bit difficult to remove. Well I went prepared. I took my pain meds; which I have been off of since Tuesday and I truly believed they helped out a alot. It was relatively painless, I felt a mild stinging sensation briefly and then it was over. I feel 10x better now that they are gone and I can shower tomorrow!!!!  :) Best to you all momwifex2
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2010 08:32PM wifemomx2 wrote: I felt like it was time to stop lurking and join you guys. I am scheduled for BMX with immediate TE's on the 17th of June. This discussion board has helped me with deal with my April 9th 2010 diagnosis tremendously. By the way, I am a 3rd generation BC survivor and I call myself a survivor because I refuse to let this dreaded disease claim my life.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2010 09:29PM wifemomx2 wrote: 3 days and counting and the anxiety is kicking in big time. Did anyone have dreams about their surgery the closer it got your date?  Everytime I go to sleep my dreams revolve around this darn surgery. I can't wait until this is over.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2010 10:40PM - edited Jun 25, 2010 10:41PM by wifemomx2 stlcardsfan- my output went I went in was slightly above 30ml but my PS felt as it was ok to remove them and they have't caused me any problems since I've left his office. As far as pain meds go I was prescribed 10mg Hydrocodone; no refill and I received this script in the hospital by my GS. Prior to surgery my PS mailed me a script days prior to surgery to have once I was released. They were 5mg Oxycodone; no refill and 5 mg Hydrocodone with 1 refill. I was taking the 10 mg hyro because that's what they were giving me after I was taken off the pain pump and I didn't know if 5mgs were going to be as effective. I haven't been in any pain per say just some mild pressure. If I had any pain I would definitely still take them as needed. My biggest problem right now is extreme fatigue and major loss of appetite. I think your pain should start to ease off very soon and I believe your drain removal will be a breeze just as mine were. My very best to you :) wifemomx2
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Title: Why Are Post Surgery Products So Expensive? wifemomx2 wifemomx2
Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: wifemomx2 wrote: I'm a newbie to this website and I have viewed a lot of post and seen where other members have have posted links to sites that offer post surgical products ie, camis,shorts, bras, scarves, drain pouches ect. Although I think these products are terrific and would be a great benefit to women who have to have these surgeries, I find them to be awfully expensive. $50 and $60 for one cami, my goodness. I have also seen (not to offend anyone) surviors who have gone through these procedures and have since invented a product to make post surgery a bit easier but what they are charging for their items are a bit costly. I would think that someone who knows first hand what this is like would be somewhat "lenient" if you will, with what they are charging those that are going through the same ugly ordeal. Just my opinion. This Too Shall Pass Dx 4/9/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Why Are Post Surgery Products So Expensive? wifemomx2 wifemomx2

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 02:52PM wifemomx2 wrote: @ hellome- I understand what you're saying but how much more does it cost to manufacture a mastectomy bra than it does a nursing bra or how much more does it cost to make a pair of shorts with pockets to hold drains than it does a regular pair of shorts? If I knew how to make clothing I probably could make a pair of shorts with hidden pockets for the same amount it would take to make an average pair of shorts. I truly feel as though we are being taken advantage of because of our NEED and the lack of places to shop for these items.
